Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: This receipt is exceptional, being a tax-receipt with the date inserted, as usual in such documents, at the end of the body of .the receipt, and, following it, a signature. It is a receipt for wine paid as tax by the monastery through its prior, or agent. A tax-receipt of different form is 1923,0327.113 (O.Sarga 369).
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.197-8)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87685) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87685)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 344 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
